comment: Jim is a really sweet guy who is passionate about his field of work. I enjoyed the class and felt like I learned from it. Discussions are important to the class. He can sometimes get defensive if he disagrees with you (strong feelings about Shakespeare), but it's pretty lighthearted, and he's not mean like some of the other reviews suggest.

Generally a nice guy. If you talk to him abt extensions, he'll likely understand and won't go out of his way to give you a hard time as long as you have valid reasons. however, he doesn't post the notes, and his tests are challenging. you have to PAY to see 2 shows. attendance is worth 3x more than the final, so show up. overall, not bad.

For theatre history, your three biggest assignments are the final paper you have to do, a presentation of that final paper, and a group presentation over an assigned reading. I tried so hard to be invested but this class was so much work. If you think you'll be busy this semester, steer clear. It's just going to pile on.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: If you aren't interested in theatre, DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS. Really nice & cares about students but as a required class, he really makes you work. Reading scripts, several essays, required to PAY to see 2 shows. HARSH grader. Will have to work in a group to create & put on a play. It's a ridiculous class if you are just trying to get prerequisites.
Very easy teacher! Class so easy. Take him! Class was an easy A.

This class is now required for freshman learning communities, but it shouldn't be. It's 1 credit hour and is not required to graduate. Jim is extremely judgemental and will only approve of whatever you're doing if it fits his sense of humor, which is incredibly random. Also, if your class is first in the week, don't expect any real effort from him.
Great prof. Gives a good amount of work, not too much. Grades reflect effort put in for the most part. Good guy, would take again.

it's an easy class ( was in the learning community for TPS) but the class is just so unnecessary anyway and he is kinda rude a lot of the time! Just do the work ( if the paper asks for 300 words don't just meet te req. like actually write the thing and meet the req) and pretend like you care and you'll get an A!
Act engaged, literally
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Davis is a really cool dude who knows the course material really well. He makes lectures super fun, but expects participation. DO NOT SKIP CLASS! He takes attendance very seriously. Overall he was an awesome teacher who made the course fun and the material understandable for everybody. I highly recommend him, as long as you're willing to work!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: No, no, no! This man is VERY VERY rude and judgmental... RUN

He makes the lectures funny and he knows what he is talking about, but beware of his tough grading on papers. He isn't joking when he says he grades harder than a composition teacher. The group projects are fun, especially the end-of-semester play(not as scary as you would think).

His class is boring often and he laughs at his own jokes. There are three plays you have to go see and write a response. He is very PICKY on the responses. All the quizzes are online but the questions are tricky. Attendance is MANDATORY because you get POINTS. An A is possible, but he will make you work for it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hes super crazy! all the test and quizzes are online and they are easy. You have to buy tickets to a couple of plays and write a response about them. Hes picky about the responses so be specific.

i wouldn't buy the textbook because i never opened it. He is very weird and funny but overall it's an easy A. Highly recommend making multiple friends in this class. He can grade hard on papers but you just have to know what you are talking about

Professor Davis is a good person. Very passionate about theater, and an overall nice guy. His lectures are very boring, and he will take points off of your attendance grade for missing class. Tests and quizzes are online. There are three responses about plays, TOUGH paper grader. Final project is performing a play. Overall, a solid choice.

He's really funny and laughs at his own jokes a lot (same). Read and actually participate in class-- it'll make class more entertaining. Super hard grader for papers and all his exams and quizzes are online
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hes super funny but kind of rude. Big group projects that are almost all of your grade. Go to class.

He is a fun guy with a major intellectual inferiority complex. A fun professor and a generally easygoing attitude. Lot's of essays but a fair grader. Condescending and moody, he likes to be right and is open minded except when it comes to being right. Generally on a day to day basis he's  cool.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Jim is a gem of a person. His humor is strange but he's great. 10/10 would recomend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Davis is an excellent professor! The coursework is fairly easy with three play responses throughout the semester. Take him!!

Laughs at his own jokes which can become annoying. You're required to buy tickets to plays outside of class and write essays on them. Tough grader. Go to class or you get points taken off your grade. Don't use a phone around him or he calls you out in front of the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: He's funny, but also slightly condescending. As in, his opinion matters and if you don't agree with it he's really mean about it. Major group project, but he grades super tough in my opinion. Have to go to performances and write about it. If he's your only option, you'd be okay, but I'd take someone else if I could.
I had a great time in this class.

Really cool guy! He's really funny and knows what he's talking about! He gives off really positive vibes and easily relates to his students. Don't use your phone in front of him though! The performances we had to see in TPS were all really cool. There is a pretty big group project you might want to look out for.

First experience with the TPS department and it was amazing. I felt like I actually learned, but had a heck of a fun time doing it. Super goofy guy- make jokes and be comfortable and he will love you. Discussion matters a lot to him and he takes attendance. Overall a great professor who loves what he does- would take again.

I took the Freshmen Semiar "Be The Change" in a theatre learning community, which was the best decision going into college. He laughs at his own jokes. Did a big project at the end of the semester which got boring after a while and had to perform it at an elementary school. Checks attendance, easy A if you do the assignments, have to go see plays.
If you pay attention and take good notes then you should be fine. He likes showing video clips on the topics you learn about. He is super funny and if you're a tumblr person you'll  love him.

Davis is a fun professor. I would recommend taking him. He likes to make jokes and he tries to make the class as fun as possible. He is always in a great mood. His tests are simple. You have to see three plays and write responses on them but he grades them very easily. Great professor.

He's a really goofy professor. He likes to laugh at his own jokes. If you use your own sense of humor to combat his own, he will LOVE you. Really easy first-year seminar class. It's all just basic knowledge. He gives a million projects all on top of each other. You don't really NEED the textbook. But if you have an extra $100, get it.

I am currently taking the class. It's really simple and easy. Show up, take some notes, call it a day. He does take attendance. He makes jokes, some actually funny, some he thinks he's funny. You have to see 3 plays, for this semester they're all at Kennesaw, so tickets about $5 a piece. Have 4 tests & reading quizzes on scripts. I like the class.

Best Professor Ever! He's awesome! I literally took this class because my friends took Music and Art and both got Bs. I'm so glad I took his class because he's really funny and witty! Even though I only took him for Maymester I learned how to think differently about almost everything. I got an A Take him!!!!!!
He's amazing and really loves what he does! I recommend taking his class. Easy A if you go to class, takes notes, and do your work!

The class is easy. You do have an attendance policy and you take a lot of notes. You have to attend one off campus production for TPS 1107 and it is not that bad if you do not wait until the last minutes. All of the exam questions are covered in class and he is a pretty easy grader.

Davis laughs at his own jokes every class period & you go over PowerPoints every day. The tests are really easy but he grades pretty strictly on written assignments. You have to go see 3 plays 1 being one outside of KSU. You also have a huge group project where you have to make & perform a play with your group. Never opened the textbook

Jim Davis is a nice guy! I really enjoyed the plays we had to see(but you have to pay to see them) The response papers were a pain to write but they were easy. I thought the topics were interesting but class could be boring. Quizzes are online. Lots of extra credit opportunities. As long as you put in effort into your responses it's an easy A

Professor Davis is super nice and yes, he does make corny jokes but it makes the class interesting. The only bad quality he has is grading harshly on responses. Other than that his quizzes are super easy and as long as you come to class you should do fine.
The class isn't hard but he isn't very pleasant to be around. He thinks he's funny and trust me he isn't. He doesn't tolerate cell phones.

He thinks he's god-like. Not a nice guy, but the class is easy enough. You have to pay about $50 to attend performances throughout the semester. Tests around online and easy, but he is a very harsh grader when it comes to play responses. Avoid him if you can. If not, he's almost bearable.

He is so rude sometimes! It's not even funny. The tests and quizzes are easy because they're online, but the responses are kind of hard; especially since he does not give clear directions. The class is boring DO NOT take it.

He is very obnoxious, and is not a very interesting teacher. The quizzes and tests are easy because they're online, but the responses are really hard. I really don't recommend this class. It's just too boring.

Dr Davis made this class sound interesting on the first day. But after the first two weeks I was over the class and didn't want to go. He HATES cell phones; "doing his class wrong," laugh is very obnoxious, you have to pay to see 3 required performances and write essays/responses on each, tests are easy and all online but I DON'T recommend him.

Funny teacher, makes class interesting! Come to class & do your work and it's an easy A. Tests are online and very easy!! You have to go see different plays throughout the semester and do discussions on each, not too hard. Takes attendance & hates cell phones. I recommend him!

Dr.Davis is super funny, and his classes are always entertaining. He maintains a good relationship with his students and is always super friendly and understanding. Sometimes he may get a little muddled on dates and such, but overall if you try your best, and participate you will get an A.

This professor is great. I had no interest or experience with Theater before this class, and I love it now. Class includes some 'adult content,' but he is very up front about it the first day of class. He is very knowledgeable, a huge fan of discussion, and very entertaining. I loved this class. Do the work, and you'll have no trouble making an A.
He is definitely passionate about his subject which made it easier to get involved.  Enjoyed the theatrical performances that we attended this semester.  It really enhanced the conversation.

Participating in Professor Davis' TPS 1107 has been a pleasure beyond compare. The Professor is passionate about his studies and is always concerned with the success of his students. He is flexible and always understanding. Overall, the Professor utilizes fascinating and intriguing discussion and debate sessions that truly enhance the class.

All these people with negative comments on Dr. Davis are CRAZY! He is a real character and his fun personality makes the learning experience engaging and interesting. He is ALL ABOUT discussion, so you get a lot of different view points. He is always willing to help his students. Awesome person, awesome prof.
I really enjoyed his class. He makes it interactive and interesting. If you go to every class and take good notes the quizzes are easy.
He has the most obnoxious laugh and makes the class so boring. I could not stand coming nto this class. Change professors.

I can't stand going to his class. All he does is pontificate about how he is either a Dr. or a Prof., but not a teacher. Fitting, because in this class, he will teach you nothing. He's scatter-brained, never tells you what he's looking for, and when it comes to a project, he will insult you, find his insult funny and laugh at his own joke. run.
Jim Davis is one of the best professors I have ever had. He makes the class fun, and gets the students involved. Out of all of the TPS1107 professors, Jim Davis is the best. Definitely take him.

Ok, just going to keep it real!  I am a director and have been working in this industry for YEARS and this guy is a joke.  It's his way or no way!  Grant it, he is the instructor, but just because he has his doctorates does not make him "the man" of theatre!  Get another instructor if you can or take it later.  Not worth your GPA!
Good teacher.Easy grader but kind of disorganized at times.

Dr. Davis's class is pretty much a joke. If you can take his lame jokes and annoying laughter then you will be able to maybe enjoy this class. There are a bunch of quizzes and test, but they are all online and you get two tries. I loved studying theater and watching plays. This class killed that for me. I would recommend finding a different teacher
professor davis makes class fun and easy to attend he grades pretty easy all you really need to do is show up and have fun

Nice guy but horrible grader. No matter what you do, he always has a negative comment. Can only miss 2 days, pointless powerpoints, some fun activities but not many, a lot of writing. Doesn't give away good grades, Not recommended if you don't have a lot of time to spare for this class.

ummm..... WEIRD! he's an alright teacher but im kinda mad i got an B in his class.... its gen ed and pointless. i he was alright but there's a bunch of little quizzes and stuff but you have to do a performance for the final. he said he loved ours and gave us a low B... so whatever

He seems a little disorganized at times, but overall its a good class with interesting lectures. He doesn't always make it clear what he wants on papers which resulted in some not so good grades for me, but he gave PLENTY of EASY extra credit to make up for it. Be prepared to show up for class and take notes, as attendance matters a lot to him.

Yeah - you have to go see plays and write about them.  It's a theatre class - what did you think we were going to do, genius?  And maybe the last poster should be more disappointed in themselves for not being able to spell the word "ridiculous."  This was a fun class and I learned a lot.  Highly recommended for people with a sense of humor.

This is a rediculous class to require for graduation. I am very disappointed in myself for even signing up for it. I did well in the class but having to listen to Davis twice a week was almost unbearable. He's obnoxious, though he feels he's funny, and absolutely rediculous when it comes to grading essays ... even if the content is good. Don't take

Expect a ton of work for this "easy" class. Class is mandatory and you must attend 4 plays including 1+page essays afterwards (that are graded for grammar, rarely content)... Do yourself a favor, and do not take this professor

Very nice guy, enjoyed his class very much...rambled about personal stories much, which I often enjoy.  Keeps class fun and interesting. Very understanding when things happen such as late assignments, just communicate with him
Jim was great teacher.  The classes were fun, I learned a lot, and we did cool projects.

Miserable. I hated this class. He is inappropriate & weird. He is unorganized, demeaning, & sarcastic. I went to every class but had to work really hard to pay attn because I did not respect him. His expectations are unclear & the tests are hard to do well on. He grades your papers harder than an english teacher & mocks your opinions.
